alert.note: Alert for Sutton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 25 at 12:03PM CDT until May 27 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Kimble, Menard and Sutton. * WHEN...Until 1245 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1200 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms...near Telegraph, with moderate rainfall northeast to Junction and London.This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding, as the storm move southeast at 30 mph. Up to 2.5 inches of rain have fallen in eastern Schleicher, western Kimble and southwest Menard county. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sonora, Junction, Roosevelt, Fort Mckavett, Telegraph, South Llano River State Park, Segovia, Yates Crossing, London, I-10 Near The Sutton-kimble County Line, The Intersection Of Ranch Road 2596 And Ranch Road 864, Camp Sol Mayer, Cleo. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 380 and 475. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Park Road 73 crossing South Llano River, US HWY 377 crossing South Llano River, FM 2169 crossing Johnson Fork Creek, US HWY 377 crossing 2 miles North of Telegraph. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
